page.title: 19TRANSPORT PROBLEMS IN LEVEN
page.content: We went outside and asked some ladies questions. These were the results. Ten out of ten thought that the bus service was poor. I asked them what improvements they would like.These were the results.Four out of ten wanted a railway but they did not specify where to. Three out of ten wanted a taxi service. Nine out of ten wanted buses hourly to Beverley and Hull;and ten out of ten wanted a bypass.Our main road gets very busy with lorries and tourists going to Bridlington,Scarborough,and Hornsea.Ten out of ten wanted a zebra crossing across the main road;as it often takes several minutes to get from one side of the village to the other.The mothers were worried about the dangerous main road.
